physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and landscape in orientation. It features a man, sitting on a beach towel on the sand. He is topless, and is posing with his arms on his knees, facing towards the top-left. He is surrounded by several personal items, including bags, bottles, and several drinking cups. The background of the photograph is quite dark. There are no inscriptions on the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen.
sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of man at the beach
